com.amazon.insights.error
Interface InsightsError

All Known Implementing Classes:
InvalidArgumentError, NullArgumentError, UnexpectedError
public interface InsightsError

InsightsError is the interface implemented by all error classes that can be returned by the API.
It can be used to get a human-readable format containing details of the error.
Note that the default behavior of the InsightsCallback class which can be used to retrieve the error, is to log the message string to the Android log.

Usage Example

The example below shows how InsightsError can be used to retrieve a description of the error Example: 
 final InsightsHandler<VariationSet> handler = insightsInstance.getABTestClient().getVariations("Level1Revenue");
 handler.setCallback(new InsightsCallback<VariationSet>() {
     public void onComplete(final VariationSet variations) {
         final Variation revenueVariation = variations.getVariation("Level1Revenue");
         
         // get the revenue variation for this user and access the message to display to user when it's time to buy
         final String buyNowMessage = revenueVariation.getVariableAsString("buyMessage", "Upgrade your character?");
         
         // Use the buyNowMessage as required in the application
     }
     
     public void onError(InsightsError error) {
         //Call the super class to log the error to the Android log
         super.onError(error);
         
         //Get the human-readable format describing the error
         final String errorString = error.getMessage();
         
         //Use errorString for debugging purposes
     }
     
 });

          Get the human-readable format that describes the error
